ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACK=n ] 
      
Specifies the number of observations before the end of the data where the
multistep forecasts are to begin. The default is BACK=0.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the SAS data set that contain the input data for the procedure to
forecast. If the DATA= option is not specified, the most recently created
SAS data set is used.

[Syntax: LEAD=n ] 
      
Specifies the number of periods ahead to forecast (forecast lead or horizon).
The default is LEAD=12.

[Syntax: MAXERROR=number ] 
      
Limits the number of warning and error messages produced during the execution
of the procedure to the specified value. The default is MAXERROR=50. This
option is particularly useful in BY-group processing where it can be used to
suppress the recurring messages.

[Syntax: NOOUTALL ] 
      
Specifies that only forecasts are written to the OUT= and OUTFOR= data sets.
The NOOUTALL option includes only the final forecast observations in the output
data sets, not the one-step forecasts for the data before the forecast period.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the forecasts of the variables that are
specified in the subsequent FORECAST statements.

[Syntax: OUTEST=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the model parameter estimates and the
associated test statistics and probability values. The OUTEST= data set is
particularly useful for evaluating the significance of the model parameters and
understanding the model dynamics.

[Syntax: OUTFOR=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the forecast time series components 
(actual, predicted, lower confidence limit, upper confidence limit, prediction
error, and prediction standard error). The OUTFOR= data set is particularly
useful for displaying the forecasts in tabular or graphical form.

[Syntax: OUTPROCINFO=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain information in the SAS log, specifically
the number of notes, errors, and warnings and the number of series processed,
forecasts requested, and forecasts failed.

[Syntax: OUTSEASON=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the seasonal statistics. The statistics
are computed for each season as specified by the ID statement INTERVAL= option
or the SEASONALITY= option. The OUTSEASON= data set is particularly useful when
analyzing transactional data for seasonal variations.

[Syntax: OUTSTAT=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the summary statistics and the forecast
summation.

[Syntax: OUTSUM=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the summary statistics and the forecast
summation.

[Syntax: OUTTREND=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the trend statistics.

[Syntax: PLOT=option | (options ) ] 
      
Specifies the graphical output desired. By default, the HPF procedure produces
no graphical output.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Plots prediction error time series graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Plots prediction error autocorrelation function graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: plots prediction error partial autocorrelation function graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Plots prediction error inverse autocorrelation function graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Plots forecast graphics with confidence limits in the data range.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Plots the forecast in the forecast horzion only.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Is the same as specifying all of the preceding PLOT= options.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PRINT=option | (options ) ] 
      
Specifies the printed output desired. By default, the HPF procedure produces no
printed output.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Prints the results of parameter estimation (OUTEST= data set).
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Prints the performance statistics for each forecast.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Prints the performance summary for each BY group.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Prints the performance summary for all of the BY groups.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Prints the seasonal statistics (OUTSEASON= data set).
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Prints the statistics of fit (OUTSTAT= data set).
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Prints the backcast, initial, and final states.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Prints the summary statistics for the accumulated time series (OUTSUM= data set).
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Prints the trend statistics (OUTTREND= data set).
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Is the same as PRINT=(ESTIMATES FORECASTS STATISTICS SUMMARY).

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PRINTDETAILS ] 
      
Specifies that output requested with the PRINT= option be printed in greater detail.

[Syntax: SEASONALITY=number ] 
      
Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle.

[Syntax: SORTNAMES ] 
      
Specifies that the variables specified in the FORECAST statements be processed in sorted order.

[Syntax: STARTSUM=n ] 
      
Specifies the starting forecast lead (or horizon) for which to begin summation
of the forecasts specified by the LEAD= option.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FORECAST variable-list / options;
      
The FORECAST statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose
accumulated values represent time series to be modeled and forecast. The
options specify which forecast model is to be used or how the forecast model is
selected from several possible candidate models.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are to be accumulated within each time
period for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

[Syntax: ALPHA=number ] 
      
Specifies the significance level to use in computing the confidence limits of
the forecast.

[Syntax: CRITERION=option ] 
      
Specifies the model selection criterion (statistic of fit) to be used to select
from several candidate models.

[Syntax: HOLDOUT=n ] 
      
Specifies the size of the holdout sample to be used for model selection. The
holdout sample is a subset of actual time series that end at the last
nonmissing observation.

[Syntax: HOLDOUTPCT=number ] 
      
Specifies the size of the holdout sample as a percentage of the length of the
time series.

[Syntax: INTERMITTENT=number ] 
      
Specifies a number greater than one which is used to determine whether or not a
time series is intermittent.

[Syntax: MEDIAN ] 
      
Specifies that the median forecast values are to be estimated. Forecasts can be
based on the mean or median. By default the mean value is provided.

[Syntax: MODEL=model-name ] 
      
Specifies the forecasting model to be used to forecast the actual time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Best candidate smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND, ADDSEASONAL, WINTERS, ADDWINTERS)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Best candidate nonseasonal smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Best candidate seasonal smoothing model (ADDSEASONAL, WINTERS, ADDWINTERS)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Intermittent demand model such as Croston’s method or average demand model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NBACKCAST=n ] 
      
Specifies the number of observations used to initialize the backcast states.

[Syntax: REPLACEBACK ] 
      
Specifies that actual values excluded by the BACK= option be replaced with
one-step-ahead forecasts in the OUT= data set.

[Syntax: REPLACEMISSING ] 
      
Specifies that embedded missing actual values be replaced with one-step-ahead
forecasts in the OUT= data set.

[Syntax: SEASONTEST=option ] 
      
Specifies the options related to the seasonality test. This option is used with
the MODEL=BEST and MODEL=BESTALL options.

[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are to be assigned
in the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

[Syntax: TRANSFORM=option ] 
      
Specifies the time series transformation to be applied to the actual time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No transformation is applied. This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Automatically choose between NONE and LOG based on model selection criteria

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: USE=option ] 
      
Specifies the time series transformation to be applied to the actual time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The predicted values are appended to the actual values. This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The lower confidence limit values are appended to the actual values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The upper confidence limit values are appended to the actual values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies the time series transformation to be applied to the actual time series.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ID variable INTERVAL= interval < options >;
      
The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the
input and output data sets. The ID variable’s values are assumed to be SAS
date, time, or datetime values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are to be accumulated within each time
period for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect to the frequency.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip14: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALIGN=option ] 
      
Controls the alignment of SAS dates used to identify output observations.

[Syntax: END=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the end of the data.

[Syntax: FORMAT=format ] 
      
Specifies the SAS format for the time ID values.

[Syntax: INTERVAL=interval ] 
      
Specifies the frequency of the input time series.

[Syntax: NOTSORTED ] 
      
Specifies that the time ID values not be in sorted order.

[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are to be assigned
in the accumulated time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Missing values are set to the accumulated average value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Missing values are set to the accumulated minimum value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Missing values are set to the accumulated median value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Missing values are set to the accumulated maximum value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Missing values are set to the accumulated first nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Missing values are set to the accumulated last nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Missing values are set to the previous accumulated nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Missing values are set to the next accumulated nonmissing value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: START=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the beginning of the data.

[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are to be assigned
in the accumulated time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: IDM options ; 
      
The IDM statement is used to specify an intermittent demand model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: AVERAGE=(smoothing-model-options ) ] 
      
Specifies the smoothing model used to forecast the demand average component.

[Syntax: BASE=AUTO | number ] 
      
Specifies the base value of the time series used to determine the demand series
components.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The base value is automatically determined by the time series median, minimum and maximum  values, and the INTERMITTENT= option value of the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INTERVAL=(smoothing-model-options ) ] 
      
Specifies the smoothing model used to forecast the demand interval component.

[Syntax: SIZE=(smoothing-model-options ) ] 
      
Specifies the smoothing model used to forecast the demand size component.
